element.BriefDescription: Neodymium is a soft silvery metal that tarnishes in air. It is present in significant quantities in the ore minerals monazite and bastnÃ¤site. Neodymium is not found naturally in metallic form or unmixed with other lanthanides, and it is usually refined for general use. Although neodymium is classed as a "rare earth", it is a fairly common element, no rarer than cobalt, nickel, and copper, and is widely distributed in the Earth's crust. Most of the world's neodymium is mined in China.
